inclusion.criterion: Obstetric patients aged 18 or more years
inclusion.label: met

inclusion.criterion: Post-dural puncture headache (PDPH) after a confirmed or likely unintentional dural puncture with an epidural needle.
inclusion.label: met

inclusion.criterion: Medically suitable for and have consented to epidural blood patch (EBP) for treatment of PDPH
inclusion.label: met

exclusion.criterion: Previous epidural blood patch (EBP) related to the same unintentional dural puncture (including prophylactic EBP)
exclusion.label: not_met

exclusion.criterion: EBP to be performed more than 5 days after the unintentional dural puncture.
exclusion.label: unknown

exclusion.criterion: History of significant low or radicular back pain (requiring treatment) during pregnancy
exclusion.label: not_met

exclusion.criterion: Women in whom a further dural puncture occurs at the time of epidural needle insertion for the EBP
exclusion.label: unknown

exclusion.criterion: Diagnosis other than PDPH subsequently confirmed.
exclusion.label: not_met

notes: The patient is a 55 year old man visiting his primary care physician for lower urinary tract symptoms. He has an IPSS score of 15 and post-void residual of 70 mL.
